function blocks() 
{
    count = 0;
    for(i=0; i<arguments.length; i++){

    }
    outlet(0, count)
}

ã“ã®é•·ã£ãŸã‚‰ã—ã„ã‚ªãƒ—ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³æŒ‡å®šãªã‚“ã¨ã‹ãªã‚‰ã‚“ã®ã‹ã€‚ã€‚

å‹•ä½œãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯

PyAudioæœ¬å®¶ã®ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚’ãã®ã¾ã¾ã‚³ãƒ”ã£ã¦å‹•ã‹ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹
http://people.csail.mit.edu/hubert/pyaudio/

[python]
"""PyAudio Example: Play a WAVE file."""

import pyaudio
import wave
import sys

CHUNK = 1024

if len(sys.argv) \< 2:
print("Plays a wave file.\n\nUsage: %s filename.wav" % sys.argv[0])
sys.exit(-1)

wf = wave.open(sys.argv[1], 'rb')

p = pyaudio.PyAudio()

stream = p.open(format=p.get_format_from_width(wf.getsampwidth()),
channels=wf.getnchannels(),
rate=wf.getframerate(),
output=True)

data = wf.readframes(CHUNK)

while data != '':
stream.write(data)
data = wf.readframes(CHUNK)

stream.stop_stream()
stream.close()

p.terminate()
[/python]
